To prevent the risk of proctitis, first you need to know how to protect yourself against sexually transmitted infections (STIs). The best way to prevent STIs is to abstain/limit sexual intercourse – especially anal sex. If you have sex, please note the following points to reduce the risk of disease:
Do not have many sexual partners; Use condoms every time you have sex; Do not have sex with someone who has ulcers or unusual discharge in the genital area
If you are diagnosed with a sexually transmitted disease, you should stop having sex until you have been completely treated.
